title: alastantiger
author: alastantiger
content: I'm not sure what everyone here thinks but I have to tell you that Renato Moicano, the UFC dude tweeted that he wants his 300k bonus in bitcoin.Now besides beating people up in the Octagon, the guy knows his money stuff. I think it is cool to see someone from outside the finance and tech field talk about bitcoin. It might not be groundbreaking but I am going to be cheering on every new person who supports bitcoin. I am hoping that down the road we'll see more UFC fighters getting paid in bitcoin, either in full or in part.-https://twitter.com/moicanoufc/status/1779368681950327053?t=onABzjQkx0n1FyPZA6p2Ug&s=19

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: He is just one athlete among many that I have heard supporting bitcoin and wanting to get paid in it. There have been older reports of US baseball and American football stars taking a part of their pay in BTC. They are thinking long-term, and understand that bitcoin traditionally goes up in the long run.A perfect example of a good strategy is what Michael Jordan did back in his days. This, of course, has nothing to do with bitcoin, but it's just an example what can happen if you have a working brain. He had a contract with Nike, but only a part of it was paid out to him in fiat. He requested the rest to be in Nike stocks. Eventually, the stocks he was given ended up being worth 10 times more than what he would have earned in fiat.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Quote from: alastantiger on April 16, 2024, 03:06:02 PMNow besides beating people up in the Octagon, the guy knows his money stuff. I think it is cool to see someone from outside the finance and tech field talk about bitcoin. It might not be groundbreaking but I am going to be cheering on every new person who supports bitcoin. I am hoping that down the road we'll see more UFC fighters getting paid in bitcoin, either in full or in part.The thing is the recent sports men we have now are not like former athletes who you will see neglect the culture of investing, the athletes now have picked up the ball idea of investing just to have a financial stable retirement not like their predecessors who most at times ends up with nothing later. Am I surprised about the inclination to bitcoin? I will say No because with all that bitcoin possess it will be hard for someone to have a research on it and not pick interest. I even feel like there are more athletes that have invested in this Bitcoin anonymously than they speak about. It’s a good move by Moicano to have treated this as a currency, hopefully he might get his request granted or even go ahead to purchase it himself. $300k worth of bitcoin now is equivalent to almost 5 bitcoin, with the much anticipated bull run if he holds for long might see a 2x return of that amount

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: I'm happy to see that the guy supports Bitcoin and want to get paid in Bitcoin. It's a positive contribution to the community of the Bitcoin because fans of that fighter will also consider Bitcoin for payments when they hear that their idol loves Bitcoin and want to get paid with it instead of fiat. It leave positive impression and I really think that guy is doing a great job.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: It is his gain really. Bitcoin is so big now that making announcements like this helps the celebrity more than it does the network. This tweet will get him more interactions on his social media than his previous posts and if his request is granted he will get an easy buy in to thousands of Bitcoin without hassling about where to buy them from. But he should get charged for the commissions needed to convert from fiat to BTC.- Jay -

I think people are gradually beginning to understand what Bitcoin is capable of and it's benefits, also the bitcoin halving have been preached over and over by crypto influencer on the media and based on the benefits that comes with it, i think a lot of people are beginning to buy the idea of investing in it currently before the main halving event starts. And based on the current dip, celebrities, business men, industries would see this as an opportunity to acquire as much Bitcoin as they can to prepare for the halving. Michael Saylor has shown as an example. In one of his interview i came across, he mentioned that he'll buy more Bitcoin instead of selling, which is a very good decision for those who hodl Bitcoin as a long term investment. Although i know that some people out of fear would begin to sell their coins because of the dip, instead of buying more.

comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on April 16, 2024, 07:17:43 PMlol, he didn't win any bonus at UFC 300, the winner from the bonus was Max Holloway. And holloway not only wins 1 bonus, but he also wins 2 bonuses for a total of 600k. Moicano knows Max won those bonuses playing clean and he even sent a message to Max saying "Huge congratulations to Max Holloway... 600k bonus he absolutely deserves!!!".So, if he wants a 300k bonus in Bitcoin, first he needs to win that bonus.The man just used the opportunity to promote Bitcoin a little, and if one day he wins the bonus, he clearly wrote how he wants to be paid. However, I think it's much smarter to invest in Bitcoin yourself without raising a lot of dust - because if you get $300k, isn't it easy to transfer that amount to an exchange and buy BTC? From a security perspective, it is not wise to tell anyone that you are your own bank, because thieves rob banks, especially if they are located in private buildings such as houses or apartments. However, perhaps the man is counting on the fact that his martial arts can deter the bad guys with such intentions💪
